Battery test Case

Module contents

Submodules

test_cases.battery.event_handlers module

Overview This module is the main power-horse for the EV-EcoSim. It includes the modules that allow GridLabD to interact with all the custom-built modules developed in EV-EcoSim. This file imports all simulated objects and their children, which is then run in the co-simulation environment.

test_cases.battery.event_handlers.find(criteria: str)

Finds and returns objects in GridLAB-D that satisfy certain criteria.

Parameters:

criteria (str) – the criterion for returning gridlabd objects e.g. node_name, load, etc.

Returns:

list of objects that satisfy the criteria.

test_cases.battery.event_handlers.find_subset_trans(criteria: str)

Finds and returns objects in gridlabd that satisfy certain criteria. This function only gets transformers for which are connected to EV charging, to save compute time.

Parameters:

criteria (str) – the criterion for returning gridlabd objects e.g. node_name, load, etc.

Returns:

list of objects that satisfy the criteria.

test_cases.battery.event_handlers.get_trans_power(trans_power_str)

Obtains power (in kVA) at transformer as a string and processes it into a float.

Parameters:

trans_power_str – Transformer power as a string.

Return pmag:

Power magnitude.

Return deg:

Angle between pmag (apparent power) and the real axis on the complex power plane.

test_cases.battery.event_handlers.get_voltage()

Obtains voltage string from GridLAB-D and processes it into float. GridLABD returns voltages in various formats, thus this processes the string voltages from the different formats into float. For more information on the formats, see the GridLabD powerflow user guide.

Returns:

Processed voltage magnitude and voltage phase arrays.

Return type:

ndarray(float).

test_cases.battery.event_handlers.on_init(t)

This defines the actions to take at very beginning of simulation, like getting objects and properties from gridlabd.

Parameters:

t – arbitrary placeholder.

Returns:

True - arbitrary value.

test_cases.battery.event_handlers.on_precommit(t)

This runs the simulation, propagating all the states of the necessary physical objects and the grid.

Parameters:

t – Arbitrary placeholder.

Return bool:

True

test_cases.battery.event_handlers.on_term(t)

Actions taken at the very end of the whole simulation, like saving data. Data not required can be commented out on the relevant line.

Parameters:

t – Default placeholder (do not change).

Returns:

True.

test_cases.battery.event_handlers.save_transformer_states()

Saves the relevant transformer states to a CSV file.

Returns:

test_cases.battery.event_handlers_oneshot module

Overview

Module for offline (non-MPC) mode. Very similar program with event_handlers.py. This file is the main power-horse for the EV-EcoSim. It includes the modules that allow GridLabD to interact with all the custom-built modules developed in EV-EcoSim.

This module imports all simulated objects and their children, which is then run in the co-simulation environment. This file is only used when offline battery optimization is done, after which a user wants to simulate the effects on the grid (without any state feedback).

test_cases.battery.event_handlers_oneshot.find(criteria)

Finds and returns objects in gridlabd that satisfy certain criteria.

Parameters:

criteria (str) – the criterion for returning gridlabd objects e.g. node_name, load, etc.

Returns:

list of objects that satisfy the criteria.

test_cases.battery.event_handlers_oneshot.get_trans_power(trans_power_str)

Obtains power at transformer as a string and processes it into a float.

Parameters:

trans_power_str – Transformer power as a string.

Return pmag:

Power magnitude.

Return deg:

Angle between pmag (apparent power) and the real axis on the complex power plane.

test_cases.battery.event_handlers_oneshot.get_voltage()

Obtains voltage string from GridLAB-D and processes it into float. GridLABD returns voltages in various formats, thus this processes the string voltages from the different formats into float. For more information on the formats, see the GridLabD powerflow user guide.

Returns:

Processed voltage magnitude and voltage phase arrays.

Return type:

ndarray(float).
